channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: 3 lightweight Dyson cordless vacuums just got super-sized discounts in the early Black Friday sales
item.description: These cordless vacuums are nimble, compact, and incredible value in Dyson's early Black Friday sale.

item.title: Google is fighting the defamation battle Meta caved on
item.description: Google filed a motion to dismiss a defamation lawsuit brought by anti-corporate diversity activist Robby Starbuck, who claimed Google’s AI falsely associated him with sexual assault allegations and a white nationalist. Starbuck’s claims against Google came after he filed a similar lawsuit against Meta, whose AI he claimed falsely asserted that he’d participated in the […]...

item.title: Pierce Brosnan Wants to Be Doctor Fate Again, and May Get His Chance
item.description: If you loved seeing Doctor Fate in 'Black Adam,' PIerce Brosnan sure thinks you'll be seeing him again soon.

item.title: The best foldable phone you can buy
item.description: Editor’s note: Black Friday doesn’t officially take place until Friday, November 28th; however, if you want to shop ahead of time, we’ve rounded up the best early Black Friday deals you can already get. A foldable phone isn’t for the faint of heart. They’re generally heavier, pricier, and have less capable cameras than a standard slab-style phone. They’re […]...

item.title: How ChatGPT works: A guide to its interface on mobile and web
item.description: A beginner's guide to the ChatGPT interface on mobile and web

item.title: Sennheiser Australia’s epic Black Friday audio sale has almost all its gear discounted – including the excellent Momentum 4 headphones from AU$269
item.description: Sennheiser Australia's Black Friday sale is now live with huge discounts on top-rated headphones, soundbars and more.

item.title: OpenAI is finally letting employees donate their equity to charity
item.description: Current and former OpenAI employees have grown increasingly frustrated by the fact that the company hasn't allowed them to donate their equity to charity in years. But OpenAI has finally seemed to bow to pressure, sending out an email from the company's equity team stating that current and former employees with eligible shares will be […]

item.title: That Epstein ‘Bubba’ email has inspired a wave of inappropriate Trump-Clinton merch on Etsy
item.description: E-commerce sellers are, perhaps predictably, looking to cash in on some of the more viral details of the recently released Jeffrey Epstein documents. Last week, Congress released more than 23,000 pages of documents from the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein’s estate to the public.

item.title: I loved this Sony Dolby Atmos soundbar when I tested it, and it’s back to its record-low price
item.description: The Sony HT-S2000, TechRadar's choice for the best budget soundbar, is back to its record-low price.

item.title: RFK Jr.’s Buddies Are Back to Undermine Vaccines
item.description: The next ACIP meeting in early December will examine the hepatitis B shot and the childhood vaccine schedule.

item.title: AI-Powered Teddy Bear Caught Talking About Sexual Fetishes and Instructing Kids How to Find Knives
item.description: OpenAI blocked access for the toymaker following the incidents.

item.title: VW and Rivian Have a Shared EV Vision, and They’re Hoping Other Companies Want In
item.description: Would you like to buy software from a German auto giant and an EV startup struggling to fund its second act?

item.title: WIRED Roundup: Fandom in Politics, Zuckerberg’s Illegal School, and Nepal’s Discord Revolution
item.description: In this episode of Uncanny Valley, we run through the top stories of the week and examine how some of the victories in the US November elections show the power of online fandom.

item.title: The new M5 MacBook Pro keeps getting cheaper ahead of Black Friday — score the best-ever price at Amazon
item.description: Find the best early Black Friday MacBook deal. The Apple MacBook Pro M5 is on sale at Amazon for $1,476, down from the normal price of $1,599.

item.title: The 4 Things You Need for a Tech Bubble
item.description: On this episode of Uncanny Valley, guest Brian Merchant walks us through a historical framework he used to analyze whether AI fits the classic signs of an economic bubble—and what that means for all of us.

item.title: Google updates its weather forecasts with a new AI model
item.description: Google debuted a new and improved AI weather model today that will be incorporated into popular products like Search, Gemini, and Pixel phones. The company’s AI-enhanced forecasts have proven themselves to be quite accurate so far. AI weather models have also been able to make predictions faster and more efficiently than conventional physics-based models. Until […]...

item.title: Move Over Crypto Bros, the AI PACs Are Here to Buy the Next Election
item.description: And they've already got their first target.

item.title: All the ‘Star Trek’ Movies Paramount Has Said It’s Trying to Make Lately
item.description: 'Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves' duo Jonathan Goldstein and John Francis Daley's film is the latest in a long line of 'Star Trek' movie projects.

item.title: In-car screens just got two big upgrades from LG and Harman – including the world's first 'dual view' OLED
item.description: Split-screen OLEDs and home cinema-quality displays are coming to cars of the future.

item.title: Frontline workers say companies aren’t being transparent about AI integration
item.description: 10% don’t even know if their workplace is using artificial intelligence. It’s not just executives or knowledge workers in offices who are using artificial intelligence. It’s being adopted in fields like healthcare, retail, hospitality, and food services, too. But frontline workers often aren’t prepared for AI adoption. In fact, many are completely unaware that it’s being implemented in their workplaces at all. ...

item.title: The academic origins of everyday tech
item.description: Four technologies that moved from campus to corner office When you open Microsoft Excel to review quarterly results or check Waze to optimize your route to the office, you’re tapping into technologies born not in corporate boardrooms, but in university labs. Thinking of innovation, our minds often jump to the titans of tech: Jobs, Musk, Altman, Gates, Bezos. But behind everyday tech innovations and healthcare breakthroughs are academic researchers whose work catalyzed billion-dollar industries....

item.title: Trump Organization Announces Tokenized Hotel Development as Crypto ‘Crime Season’ Continues
item.description: There's a big crypto pot just waiting for anyone to put money into it.

item.title: Valar Atomics Says It’s the First Nuclear Startup to Achieve Criticality
item.description: A Trump administration pilot program aims for three nuclear startups to reach a key milestone by July 4, 2026. Valar Atomics says it’s the first to do so—but it had some help.

item.title: The Game Awards 2025 full nominations revealed, and theres a clear frontrunner
item.description: The full list of categories and nominations for The Game Awards 2025 have been officially revealed. Find out which games were tapped for Game of the Year.
